hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Shift on Failed High-Volume Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime and experiences a high-volume (>1.5x 30-day average) breakout attempt above a key resistance level (e.g., 90-day high) that fails to close above it, followed by a 4-hour close back below the level, a transition to a BEAR regime is likely within the next 48 hours, presenting a short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a neutral, indecisive market, a high-volume failure at a key technical level represents a classic 'bull trap.' It signals exhaustion of buying pressure and a shift in order flow, often preceding a bearish regime as disappointed longs exit and new shorts enter. The high volume confirms significant participation in the failed move.
entry_conditions: BTC price makes a 4-hour candle with volume > 1.5x 30-day avg, pushing above the 90-day high
The 4-hour candle CLOSES below the 90-day high (failed breakout)
The subsequent 4-hour candle also closes below the 90-day high (confirmation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price drop from entry OR regime model shifts to BEAR (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 4-hour close > 2% above the failed breakout level (90-day high)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals are followed by a successful breakout above the level within 48 hours instead of a bearish transition.
